strategy: Create a new feature "age_group" derived from age bins (e.g., child, young adult, adult, senior) and interact it with the "alone" flag (e.g., "alone_child", "alone_adult") to model how social dynamics and age co-vary in survival outcomes.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering: family size and alone flag
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1
train_df['Alone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['Alone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Create age groups
age_bins = [0, 12, 18, 35, 60, 100]
age_labels = ['Child', 'Teen', 'Young Adult', 'Adult', 'Senior']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Create interaction features
train_df['AloneChild'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Child')
test_df['AloneChild'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Child')
train_df['AloneYoungAdult'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Young Adult')
test_df['AloneYoungAdult'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Young Adult')
train_df['AloneAdult'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Adult')
test_df['AloneAdult'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Adult')
train_df['AloneSenior'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Senior')
test_df['AloneSenior'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Senior')

# Drop irrelevant columns
columns_to_drop = ['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin', 'AgeGroup']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Handle missing values
train_df['Age'].fillna(train_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering: family size and alone flag
train_df['FamilySize'] = train_df['SibSp'] + train_df['Parch'] + 1
test_df['FamilySize'] = test_df['SibSp'] + test_df['Parch'] + 1
train_df['Alone'] = (train_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_df['Alone'] = (test_df['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Create age groups
age_bins = [0, 12, 18, 35, 60, 100]
age_labels = ['Child', 'Teen', 'Young Adult', 'Adult', 'Senior']
train_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(train_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_df['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_df['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Create interaction features
train_df['AloneChild'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Child')
train_df['AloneYoungAdult'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Young Adult')
train_df['AloneAdult'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Adult')
train_df['AloneSenior'] = (train_df['Alone'] == 1) & (train_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Senior')

test_df['AloneChild'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Child')
test_df['AloneYoungAdult'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Young Adult')
test_df['AloneAdult'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Adult')
test_df['AloneSenior'] = (test_df['Alone'] == 1) & (test_df['AgeGroup'] == 'Senior')

# Drop irrelevant columns
columns_to_drop = ['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin', 'AgeGroup']
train_df = train_df.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test_df = test_df.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
